data.title: Robert Bontine Cunninghame Graham ('Statesmen. No. 549.') Greetings Card
data.meta_description: Send them something special with a greetings card printed to order from over 138,000 images from the National Portrait Gallery Collection
data.text:
Blank greetings card with envelope featuring:

Robert Bontine Cunninghame Graham ('Statesmen. No. 549.') NPG D44400

© National Portrait Gallery, London

by Sir Leslie Ward

At seventeen Graham set out for South America, and became known as a great adventurer. He travelled in Morocco disguised as a Turkish sheik, prospected for gold in Spain, befriended Buffalo Bill in Texas, and taught fencing in Mexico City. He returned to the UK in 1883, became interested in socialist politics and was elected a Liberal MP in 1886. A supporter of Scottish independence, that year he helped establish the Scottish Home Rule Association. In 1888 he founded the Scottish Labour Party with ... more
